intro: Pedicularis rechingeri, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its vivid red or orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Pedicularis rechingeri thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows.
